oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of different intrauterine oxytetracycline treatment on reproductive performance of dairy cows with clinical endometritis and determination of oxytetracycline residues in milk
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Makki, Meisam
Gheisari, Hamid Reza
Ahmadi, Mohammad Rahim
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: intrauterine
oxytetracycline
uterine lumen
OTC
postpartum endometritis
dairy cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Following intrauterine administration of oxytetracycline, therapeutic concentration and drug action will be restricted to the uterine lumen and endometrium. The main objective of this study was to see whether intrauterine infusion of oxytetracycline (OTC) is an appropriate method for the treatment of postpartum endometritis in dairy cows.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2015; 264
